title: PM to Propose Summit with Abe in November
text:
Prime Minister Lee Nak-yon is expected to propose a Korea-Japan summit in November when he meets Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe in Tokyo next week.

Seoul hopes to propose talks between Abe and President Moon Jae-in to find a solution to a deepening spat between the neighbors sparked by compensation for Korean forced laborers.

But Lee will be given just 15 minutes to talk with Abe after the enthronement ceremony of new Japanese Emperor Naruhito on Oct. 22.

"There won't be much time for them to talk in detail," a diplomatic source said. "Lee will only focus on laying the foundation for a summit."

Seoul hopes Moon and Abe can meet on the sidelines of the ASEAN Plus Three Summit in Thailand from Oct. 31 to Nov. 4 or the APEC Summit in Santiago, Chile on Nov. 16-17.
description: PM to Propose Summit with Abe in November
